info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 20 at 5:45PM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...Thunderstorms with gusty winds will impact portions of central Lewis and Clark, Pondera, Teton, western Chouteau and northwestern Cascade Counties through 630 PM MDT... At 542 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 7 miles southwest of Heart Butte to 14 miles north of Wolf Creek. Movement was east at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph will develop well east of the thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Great Falls, Conrad, Choteau, Cascade, Fairfield, Valier, Dutton, Fort Shaw, Brady, Heart Butte, Augusta, Fort Shaw, Power, Dupuyer, Pishkun Reservoir, Eden, First Peoples Buffalo Jump State Park, Ulm, Simms and Ledger. This includes the following highways... Interstate 15 between mile markers 247 and 348. Highway 200 between mile markers 93 and 139. Highway 287 between mile markers 9 and 64. Highway 89 between mile markers 9 and 83, and between mile markers 1 and 8. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
